intro: Eleocharis liukiuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu spike-rush, is a flowering plant species native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. This species is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered spikelets that bear tiny flowers. Eleocharis liukiuensis typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as ponds and flooded meadows. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local wetland ecosystems.
